title: Drawing, "Sketchbook: Folio 73; Six Paintings of Bolognese School; Verso: Anatomical Drawings", 1811–14
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: At top, Hercules; inscribed: Francia Bologna. Right between ship and horsemen, inscribed: Tibaldi Bologna. Center: Hercules and Omphale. Omphale teaches Hercules to play flute. Inscribed: Francia Bologna. Bottom row: Virgin holding Child in her lap.  Virgin suckling Child. Inscribed: Ludovico Caracci Bologna. Top left: 136; left top corner: 73.  Verso: left arm lowered, right hand raised.  Muscles marked by figures 1-26; "20" used twice.  Their explanations given at left: "1 frontale", ending "27 zigonactico."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketchbook: Folio 73; Six Paintings of Bolognese School; Verso: Anatomical Drawings", 1811–14.
1811–14. Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2197.
